TITLE: Configuring SearXNG Server Settings in YAML
DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration block defines the server settings for a SearXNG instance. It includes settings for base URL, port, binding address, security, rate limiting, and HTTP headers. Each setting can be customized according to deployment needs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/settings/settings_server.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
server:
    base_url: http://example.org/location  # change this!
    port: 8888
    bind_address: "127.0.0.1"
    secret_key: "ultrasecretkey"           # change this!
    limiter: false
    public_instance: false
    image_proxy: false
    default_http_headers:
      X-Content-Type-Options : nosniff
      X-Download-Options : noopen
      X-Robots-Tag : noindex, nofollow
      Referrer-Policy : no-referrer
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling SearXNG Site on Ubuntu/Debian
DESCRIPTION: Commands to create a symlink for the SearXNG site configuration in NGINX on Ubuntu or Debian-based systems.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/installation-nginx.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
sudo -H ln -s /etc/nginx/sites-available/searxng.conf \
               /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/searxng.conf
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Complete Engine Configuration Example
DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive example showing all possible configuration options for a search engine, including network settings, timeout values, and authentication options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/settings/settings_engines.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- name: example
  engine: example
  shortcut: demo
  base_url: 'https://{language}.example.com/'
  send_accept_language_header: false
  categories: general
  timeout: 3.0
  api_key: 'apikey'
  disabled: false
  language: en_US
  tokens: [ 'my-secret-token' ]
  weight: 1
  display_error_messages: true
  about:
     website: https://example.com
     wikidata_id: Q306656
     official_api_documentation: https://example.com/api-doc
     use_official_api: true
     require_api_key: true
     results: HTML

  # overwrite values from section 'outgoing:'
  enable_http2: false
  retries: 1
  max_connections: 100
  max_keepalive_connections: 10
  keepalive_expiry: 5.0
  using_tor_proxy: false
  proxies:
    http:
      - http://proxy1:8080
      - http://proxy2:8080
    https:
      - http://proxy1:8080
      - http://proxy2:8080
      - socks5://user:password@proxy3:1080
      - socks5h://user:password@proxy4:1080

  # other network settings
  enable_http: false
  retry_on_http_error: true # or 403 or [404, 429]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running SearXNG Docker Container with Volume Mount
DESCRIPTION: Commands to pull and run the SearXNG docker container with custom configuration. This example creates a local directory for settings, maps port 8080, and sets environment variables for basic configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/installation-docker.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ mkdir my-instance
$ cd my-instance
$ export PORT=8080
$ docker pull searxng/searxng
$ docker run --rm \
                -d -p ${PORT}:8080 \
                -v "${PWD}/searxng:/etc/searxng" \
                -e "BASE_URL=http://localhost:$PORT/" \
                -e "INSTANCE_NAME=my-instance" \
                searxng/searxng
2f998.... # container's ID
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring SearXNG Server Settings in YAML
DESCRIPTION: Configuration snippet from the reference settings.yml file that enables essential features for public SearXNG instances. It activates request rate limiting, image proxying, and static file hashing for improved security and caching.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/architecture.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
server:
  # WARNING: use {} to specify default value (see https://github.com/searxng/searxng/issues/1853)
  secret_key: "\"\\\${SECRET_KEY}\""  # change this!
  limiter: true  # rate limit the number of request on the instance, block some bots
  image_proxy: true  # proxying images is enabled
  timeout: 4.0   # a timeout of 4 seconds is suitable for a public instance

ui:
  static_use_hash: true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring SearXNG UI Settings in YAML
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration block defining various UI settings for SearXNG including static file hashing, localization, theme settings, cache URL configuration, and search behavior preferences. These settings control the visual appearance and interaction behavior of the SearXNG instance.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/settings/settings_ui.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
ui:
  static_use_hash: false
  default_locale: ""
  query_in_title: false
  infinite_scroll: false
  center_alignment: false
  cache_url: https://web.archive.org/web/
  default_theme: simple
  theme_args:
    simple_style: auto
  search_on_category_select: true
  hotkeys: default
  url_formatting: pretty
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning SearXNG Repository
DESCRIPTION: Command to clone the SearXNG source code repository from GitHub to start development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/dev/quickstart.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/searxng/searxng.git searxng
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing SearXNG Development Tools with searxng.sh
DESCRIPTION: Uses the searxng.sh utility to install all required build and development tools for SearXNG on the host system. This installs packages needed for SearXNG operation as well as documentation building and testing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/buildhosts.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ sudo -H ./utils/searxng.sh install buildhost
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up SearXNG Configuration in YAML
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the recommended default settings.yml configuration for SearXNG. It enables the limiter to protect against bots, image proxy for better privacy, and cache busting to save bandwidth.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/installation-searxng.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
use_default_settings: True

server:
    # base_url is defined in the DEFAULT_SETTINGS
    secret_key: "ultrasecretkey"  # change this!
    limiter: True  # rate limit the number of request on the instance, block some bots
    image_proxy: True  # proxying image results through SearXNG
    default_http_headers:
        X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
        X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
        X-Download-Options: noopen
        X-Robots-Tag: noindex, nofollow
        Referrer-Policy: no-referrer

ui:
    static_use_hash: True

```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Tests
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to run various tests using make commands, including pylint, PEP8, unit tests, and shell tests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/dev/makefile.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ make test.pep8 test.unit test.shell
TEST      test.pep8 OK
...
TEST      test.unit OK
...
TEST      test.shell OK
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Engine Keep-Only Configuration in YAML
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to maintain only specific engines in the configuration while removing all others, including setting custom tokens for the kept engines.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/settings/settings.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
use_default_settings:
  engines:
    keep_only:
      - google
      - duckduckgo
server:
  secret_key: "ultrasecretkey"   # change this!
engines:
  - name: google
    tokens: ['$ecretValue']
  - name: duckduckgo
    tokens: ['$ecretValue']
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Search Settings in YAML for SearXNG
DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration block defines various search settings for SearXNG, including safe search level, autocomplete options, favicon resolver, default language, and error handling parameters. It also specifies supported result formats.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/settings/settings_search.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
search:
  safe_search: 0
  autocomplete: ""
  favicon_resolver: ""
  default_lang: ""
  ban_time_on_fail: 5
  max_page: 0
  max_ban_time_on_fail: 120
  suspended_times:
    SearxEngineAccessDenied: 86400
    SearxEngineCaptcha: 86400
    SearxEngineTooManyRequests: 3600
    cf_SearxEngineCaptcha: 1296000
    cf_SearxEngineAccessDenied: 86400
    recaptcha_SearxEngineCaptcha: 604800
  formats:
    - html
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Outgoing Communication Settings in YAML for SearXNG
DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration block defines various settings for outgoing requests in SearXNG, including timeouts, user agent information, connection pooling, and proxy options. It also includes commented-out sections for custom server certificates and proxy configurations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/settings/settings_outgoing.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
outgoing:
  request_timeout: 2.0       # default timeout in seconds, can be override by engine
  max_request_timeout: 10.0  # the maximum timeout in seconds
  useragent_suffix: ""       # information like an email address to the administrator
  pool_connections: 100      # Maximum number of allowable connections, or null
                             # for no limits. The default is 100.
  pool_maxsize: 10           # Number of allowable keep-alive connections, or null
                             # to always allow. The default is 10.
  enable_http2: true         # See https://www.python-httpx.org/http2/
  # uncomment below section if you want to use a custom server certificate
  # see https://www.python-httpx.org/advanced/#changing-the-verification-defaults
  # and https://www.python-httpx.org/compatibility/#ssl-configuration
  #  verify: ~/.mitmproxy/mitmproxy-ca-cert.cer
  #
  # uncomment below section if you want to use a proxyq see: SOCKS proxies
  #   https://2.python-requests.org/en/latest/user/advanced/#proxies
  # are also supported: see
  #   https://2.python-requests.org/en/latest/user/advanced/#socks
  #
  #  proxies:
  #    all://:
  #      - http://proxy1:8080
  #      - http://proxy2:8080
  #
  #  using_tor_proxy: true
  #
  # Extra seconds to add in order to account for the time taken by the proxy
  #
  #  extra_proxy_timeout: 10.0
  #
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding User to Docker Group in Linux
DESCRIPTION: Command to add the current user to the docker group on Linux, which allows running docker commands without sudo. User needs to log out and log back in for group membership to be applied.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/installation-docker.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ sudo usermod -a -G docker $USER
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating SearXNG Instance Using searxng.sh Script
DESCRIPTION: Command to update a SearXNG instance that was installed using the installation scripts. This uses the update command from the searxng.sh utility script.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/update-searxng.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
sudo -H ./utils/searxng.sh instance update
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Private Engine Configuration with Token
DESCRIPTION: Example of configuring a private engine with access token for the Arch Linux Wiki search.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/settings/settings_engines.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
- name: arch linux wiki
  engine: archlinux
  shortcut: al
  tokens: [ 'my-secret-token' ]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Embedding SearXNG Search Bar in HTML
DESCRIPTION: HTML form code to embed a SearXNG search bar into external websites. The example shows how to customize search parameters including query, categories, language, locale, and time range filters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/api.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<form method="post" action="https://example.org/">
  <!-- search      --> <input type="text" name="q">
  <!-- categories  --> <input type="hidden" name="categories" value="general,social media">
  <!-- language    --> <input type="hidden" name="lang" value="all">
  <!-- locale      --> <input type="hidden" name="locale" value="en">
  <!-- date filter --> <input type="hidden" name="time_range" value="month">
</form>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Basic Engine Configuration in Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to define basic configuration options for a SearXNG engine adapter in the engine's Python module. It sets categories, paging support, and a non-overwritten global variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/dev/engines/engine_overview.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
# engine dependent config
categories = ['general']
paging = True
_non_overwritten_global = 'foo'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Python Packages for SearXNG
DESCRIPTION: Commands to update Python packages and install SearXNG in the virtual environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/build-templates/searxng.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ sudo -H -u ${SERVICE_USER} -i

(${SERVICE_USER})$ command -v python && python --version
$SEARXNG_PYENV/bin/python
Python 3.11.10

# update pip's boilerplate ..
pip install -U pip
pip install -U setuptools
pip install -U wheel
pip install -U pyyaml

# jump to SearXNG's working tree and install SearXNG into virtualenv
(${SERVICE_USER})$ cd "$SEARXNG_SRC"
(${SERVICE_USER})$ pip install --use-pep517 --no-build-isolation -e .
```

TITLE: Deploying Documentation to GitHub Pages
DESCRIPTION: Command to clean, rebuild, and deploy the documentation to GitHub Pages. This Makefile target handles the building and all necessary git operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/dev/contribution_guide.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ make docs.clean docs.gh-pages
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running SearXNG Docker Container with Command Line Help
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the SearXNG Docker container in interactive mode to display the help text from the container's entrypoint script.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/installation-docker.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -it searxng/searxng -h
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring SearXNG with Default Settings
DESCRIPTION: Commands to create the SearXNG configuration directory and copy the default settings file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/build-templates/searxng.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ sudo -H mkdir -p "$(dirname ${SEARXNG_SETTINGS_PATH})"
$ sudo -H cp "$SEARXNG_SRC/utils/templates/etc/searxng/settings.yml" \
             "${SEARXNG_SETTINGS_PATH}"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring General Settings in SearXNG YAML
DESCRIPTION: Core configuration block for SearXNG general settings. Includes debug mode, instance name, various URL configurations, and metrics settings. These settings control basic instance behavior and public-facing elements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/settings/settings_general.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
general:
  debug: false
  instance_name:  "SearXNG"
  privacypolicy_url: false
  donation_url: false
  contact_url: false
  enable_metrics: true
  open_metrics: ''
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring uWSGI for SearXNG on Fedora/RHEL
DESCRIPTION: uWSGI configuration file for SearXNG on Fedora/RHEL systems. It sets up a uWSGI instance that listens on a Unix socket and enables cache busting.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/installation-uwsgi.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: ini
CODE:
```
[uwsgi]
uid = searxng
gid = searxng

# disable logging for privacy
disable-logging = true

# Number of workers (usually CPU count)
workers = 4

# The right granted on the created socket
chmod-socket = 666

# Plugin to use and interpretor config
plugin = python3
single-interpreter = true

# Module to import
module = searx.webapp

# Setup up search instance environment
env = SEARXNG_SETTINGS_PATH=/etc/searxng/settings.yml

# Virtualenv and python path
virtualenv = /usr/local/searxng
pythonpath = /usr/local/searxng

# Cache Busting
offload-threads = %k
static-map = /static=/usr/local/searxng/searx/static
route-uri = ^/static/practi.ff22940e9968cf0461dd.css$ static:/usr/local/searxng/searx/static/practi.css
route-uri = ^/static/(.+) addheader:Cache-Control: public, max-age=31536000
route-uri = ^/static/themes/oscar/css/logicodev.1daf88f9cb5f4ee47261.css$ static:/usr/local/searxng/searx/static/themes/oscar/css/logicodev.css

socket = /run/uwsgi/searxng.sock
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Engine Configuration Structure in YAML
DESCRIPTION: Shows the basic structure for configuring multiple search engines in SearXNG's settings.yml file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/settings/settings_engines.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
engines:

  - name: dummy.online
    engine: dummy
    ..
  - name: dummy.offline
    engine: dummy-offline
    ..
  ..
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing SearXNG with Default Settings in Bash
DESCRIPTION: This command installs SearXNG with default settings using the installation script. It requires sudo privileges and installs all components, including a uWSGI setup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/installation-scripts.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ sudo -H ./utils/searxng.sh install all
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Language Settings in YAML for SearXNG
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet demonstrates how to configure available languages for SearXNG. It includes a list of language codes and a special 'all' option for the default language.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/settings/settings_search.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
languages:
  - all
  - en
  - en-US
  - de
  - it-IT
  - fr
  - fr-BE
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing SearXNG Suite and Nginx
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install the complete SearXNG suite and Nginx HTTP proxy in the container.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/dev/lxcdev.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ sudo -H ./utils/lxc.sh install suite searxng-archlinux
$ sudo -H ./utils/lxc.sh cmd -- FORCE_TIMEOUT=0 ./utils/searxng.sh install nginx
$ sudo ./utils/lxc.sh show suite | grep SEARXNG_URL
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Server Configuration with Default Settings in YAML
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to override default settings with custom server configuration, specifically setting a secret key and bind address while inheriting other default settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/settings/settings.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
use_default_settings: true
server:
    secret_key: "ultrasecretkey"   # change this!
    bind_address: "[::]"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Engine Configuration with Token Settings in YAML
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to configure specific engines while maintaining default settings, including enabling the Bing engine and setting a token for the Arch Linux wiki engine.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/settings/settings.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
use_default_settings: true
server:
  secret_key: "ultrasecretkey"   # change this!
engines:
  - name: arch linux wiki
    tokens: ['$ecretValue']
  - name: bing
    disabled: false
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing NGINX on Ubuntu/Debian
DESCRIPTION: Command to install NGINX on Ubuntu or Debian-based systems using apt-get.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/installation-nginx.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
sudo -H apt-get install nginx
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Chaining Multiple Search Engines and Categories in SearXNG
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to chain multiple search engines and categories using '!' prefixes for a comprehensive search about Jakarta.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/searx/infopage/id/search-syntax.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
{{search('!map !ddg !wp Jakarta')}}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Category Tabs in SearXNG using YAML
DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration defines which search categories will be displayed as tabs in the SearXNG user interface. Only categories with active engines will be shown as tabs, and engines in categories not listed here can still be searched using search syntax.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/settings/settings_categories_as_tabs.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
categories_as_tabs:
  general:
  images:
  videos:
  news:
  map:
  music:
  it:
  science:
  files:
  social media:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Redis URL in SearXNG YAML Settings
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration snippet for setting the Redis URL in SearXNG. This example uses a Unix socket connection to a local Redis instance.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/settings/settings_redis.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
redis:
  url: unix:///usr/local/searxng-redis/run/redis.sock?db=0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring SearXNG with Minimal Setup
DESCRIPTION: Command to generate a random secret key for SearXNG's configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/build-templates/searxng.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ sudo -H sed -i -e "s/ultrasecretkey/$(openssl rand -hex 16)/g" \
              "$SEARXNG_SETTINGS_PATH"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring uWSGI for SearXNG on Ubuntu/Debian
DESCRIPTION: uWSGI configuration file for SearXNG on Ubuntu/Debian systems. It sets up a uWSGI instance that listens on a Unix socket and enables cache busting.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/installation-uwsgi.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: ini
CODE:
```
[uwsgi]
uid = searxng
gid = searxng

# disable logging for privacy
disable-logging = true

# Number of workers (usually CPU count)
workers = 4

# The right granted on the created socket
chmod-socket = 666

# Plugin to use and interpretor config
plugin = python3
single-interpreter = true

# Module to import
module = searx.webapp

# Setup up search instance environment
env = SEARXNG_SETTINGS_PATH=/etc/searxng/settings.yml

# Virtualenv and python path
virtualenv = /usr/local/searxng
pythonpath = /usr/local/searxng

# automatically set uid/gid/umask for protocol defined in socket key
manage-script-name = true
mount = /searxng=searx.webapp:application

# Cache Busting
offload-threads = %k
static-map = /static=/usr/local/searxng/searx/static
route-uri = ^/static/practi.ff22940e9968cf0461dd.css$ static:/usr/local/searxng/searx/static/practi.css
route-uri = ^/static/(.+) addheader:Cache-Control: public, max-age=31536000
route-uri = ^/static/themes/oscar/css/logicodev.1daf88f9cb5f4ee47261.css$ static:/usr/local/searxng/searx/static/themes/oscar/css/logicodev.css

http-socket = /run/uwsgi/app/searxng/socket
```

TITLE: Configuring uWSGI for SearXNG on Arch Linux
DESCRIPTION: uWSGI configuration file for SearXNG on Arch Linux systems. It sets up a uWSGI instance that listens on a Unix socket and enables cache busting.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/installation-uwsgi.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: ini
CODE:
```
[uwsgi]
uid = searxng
gid = searxng

# disable logging for privacy
disable-logging = true

# Number of workers (usually CPU count)
workers = 4

# The right granted on the created socket
chmod-socket = 666

# Plugin to use and interpretor config
plugin = python
single-interpreter = true

# Module to import
module = searx.webapp

# Setup up search instance environment
env = SEARXNG_SETTINGS_PATH=/etc/searxng/settings.yml

# Virtualenv and python path
virtualenv = /usr/local/searxng
pythonpath = /usr/local/searxng

# Cache Busting
offload-threads = %k
static-map = /static=/usr/local/searxng/searx/static
route-uri = ^/static/practi.ff22940e9968cf0461dd.css$ static:/usr/local/searxng/searx/static/practi.css
route-uri = ^/static/(.+) addheader:Cache-Control: public, max-age=31536000
route-uri = ^/static/themes/oscar/css/logicodev.1daf88f9cb5f4ee47261.css$ static:/usr/local/searxng/searx/static/themes/oscar/css/logicodev.css

socket = /run/uwsgi/searxng.sock
```

TITLE: Defining Infobox Structure in Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet outlines the structure of an infobox result in SearXNG. It includes the main fields (img_src, infobox, content) and the subsections for attributes, urls, and relatedTopics. Each subsection is defined as a list of dictionaries with specific keys.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/dev/result_types/infobox.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
infobox_result = {
    "img_src": str,  # URL of image or thumbnail
    "infobox": str,  # Title of the info box
    "content": str,  # Text of the info box
    "attributes": [
        {
            "label": str,  # (mandatory)
            "value": str,  # (mandatory)
            "image": [
                {
                    "src": str,  # URL of image/thumbnail (mandatory)
                    "alt": str,  # alternative text for the image (mandatory)
                }
            ]  # (optional)
        }
    ],
    "urls": [
        {
            "url": str,  # URL of the link (mandatory)
            "title": str,  # Title of the link (mandatory)
        }
    ],
    "relatedTopics": [
        {
            "name": str,  # (mandatory)
            "suggestions": [
                {
                    "suggestion": str  # suggested search term (mandatory)
                }
            ]  # (optional)
        }
    ]
}
```

```
# start webapp

(${SERVICE_USER})$ cd ${SEARXNG_SRC}
(${SERVICE_USER})$ export SEARXNG_SETTINGS_PATH="${SEARXNG_SETTINGS_PATH}"
```

TITLE: Coding Guidelines in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Clean code principles and coding guidelines for the project, referencing PEP 8 and PEP 20 standards.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
* Simpler is better. [KISS principle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/KISS_principle)
* Be consistent.
* Every function must do one thing.
* Use descriptive names for functions and variables.
* Always look for the root cause.
* Keep configurable data high level.
* Avoid negative conditionals.
* Prefer fewer arguments.
* Do not add obvious comment to code.
* Do not comment out code, just delete lines.
```

TITLE: Basic Favicons TOML Configuration
DESCRIPTION: TOML configuration for SearXNG favicons with schema version and cache settings. This defines the configuration schema version which is required for the favicons system.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/admin/searx.favicons.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: toml
CODE:
```
[favicons]

cfg_schema = 1   # config's schema version no.

[favicons.cache]

db_url = "/var/cache/searxng/faviconcache.db"  # default: "/tmp/faviconcache.db"
LIMIT_TOTAL_BYTES = 2147483648                 # 2 GB / default: 50 MB
# HOLD_TIME = 5184000                            # 60 days / default: 30 days
```

TITLE: Generating Engine Tables using Jinja and reStructuredText
DESCRIPTION: This complex snippet uses Jinja templating within reStructuredText to generate tables of configured search engines. It iterates through categories and engine groups, displaying detailed information for each engine.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/user/configured_engines.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: reStructuredText
CODE:
```
.. jinja:: searx

   {% for category, engines in categories_as_tabs.items() %}

   tab ``!{{category.replace(' ', '_')}``
   ---------------------------------------

   {% for group, group_bang, engines in engines | group_engines_in_tab %}

   {% if loop.length > 1 %}
   {% if group_bang %}group ``{{group_bang}}``{% else %}{{group}}{% endif %}
   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
   {% endif %}

   .. flat-table::
      :header-rows: 2
      :stub-columns: 1
      :widths: 10 1 10 1 1 1 1 1 1 1

      * - :cspan:`5` Engines configured by default (in :ref:`settings.yml <engine settings>`)
        - :cspan:`3` :ref:`Supported features <engine file>`

      * - Name
        - !bang
        - Module
        - Disabled
        - Timeout
        - Weight
        - Paging
        - Locale
        - Safe search
        - Time range

      {% for mod in engines %}

      * - `{{mod.name}} <{{mod.about and mod.about.website}}>`_
          {%- if mod.about and  mod.about.language %}
          ({{mod.about.language | upper}})
          {%- endif %}
        - ``!{{mod.shortcut}}``
        - {%- if 'searx.engines.' + mod.__name__ in documented_modules %}
          :py:mod:`~searx.engines.{{mod.__name__}}`
          {%- else %}
          :origin:`{{mod.__name__}} <searx/engines/{{mod.__name__}}.py>`
          {%- endif %}
        - {{(mod.disabled and "y") or ""}}
        - {{mod.timeout}}
        - {{mod.weight or 1 }}
        {% if mod.engine_type == 'online' %}
        - {{(mod.paging and "y") or ""}}
        - {{(mod.language_support and "y") or ""}}
        - {{(mod.safesearch and "y") or ""}}
        - {{(mod.time_range_support and "y") or ""}}
        {% else %}
        - :cspan:`3` not applicable ({{mod.engine_type}})
        {% endif %}

     {% endfor %}
     {% endfor %}
     {% endfor %}
```

TITLE: SVG XML Code Example
DESCRIPTION: Example showing SVG markup for creating a diagonal arrow graphic.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/dev/reST.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" version="1.1"
     baseProfile="full" width="70px" height="40px"
     viewBox="0 0 700 400"
     >
  <line x1="180" y1="370"
        x2="500" y2="50"
        stroke="black" stroke-width="15px"
        />
  <polygon points="585 0 525 25 585 50"
           transform="rotate(135 525 25)"
           />
</svg>
```

TITLE: Commit Message Guidelines in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Guidelines for writing commit messages, including format requirements and best practices.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
* Always write descriptive commit messages ("fix bug" is not acceptable).
* Use the present tense ("Add feature" not "Added feature").
* Use the imperative mood ("Move cursor to..." not "Moves cursor to...").
* Limit the first line to 72 characters or less.
* Include the number of the issue you are fixing.
```

TITLE: Creating Python Virtual Environment for SearXNG
DESCRIPTION: Commands to create a Python virtual environment for SearXNG and add activation to the user's profile.
SOURCE: https://github.com/searxng/searxng/blob/master/docs/build-templates/searxng.rst#2025-04-21_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
(${SERVICE_USER})$ python3 -m venv "${SEARXNG_PYENV}"
(${SERVICE_USER})$ echo ". ${SEARXNG_PYENV}/bin/activate" \
                   >>  "$SERVICE_HOME/.profile"
```
